item.title: 摩根大通分析师称，裕信银行应尽快对德国商业银行采取行动
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：UniCredit SpA should act quickly if it wants to be successful in a potential acquisition of Commerzbank AG, according to analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 南非四年来首次降低利率
item.description: 南非央行降息 25 个基点，将利率从 15 年来的高点下调，这也是四年多来的首次宽松。【原文：South Africa’s central bank cut interest rates by 25 basis points, lowering them from a 15-year high and marking the first easing in more than four years.】

item.title: 美国向抗击厄尔尼诺的非洲农民提供 8000 万美元援助
item.description: 美国在一项新计划中承诺提供 8000 多万美元的资金，帮助三个南部非洲国家提高农业产量，美国认为这三个国家有潜力向更广泛的地区供应粮食。【原文：The US has committed more than $80 million in funding under a new program to help grow agricultural output in three southern African nations it sees as having the potential to supply food to the broader region.】

item.title: 亚马逊推出人工智能助理，帮助网商繁荣发展
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）正在推出一款人工智能助手，旨在帮助在线商家管理业务。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is launching an artificially intelligent assistant designed to help online merchants manage their businesses.】

item.title: 瑞士交易所将进军碳减排信用额市场
item.description: 瑞士证券交易所运营商 SIX 集团正在扩大碳清除市场，试图实现产品多样化。【原文：Swiss stock exchange operator SIX Group AG is expanding in the carbon removal market as it attempts to diversify its offerings.】

item.title: 马斯拉尼在美国调查中退休，道明银行任命秦致为首席执行官
item.description: 多伦多道明银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）表示，该行首席执行官巴拉特-马斯拉尼（Bharat Masrani）将于 4 月份退休，雷蒙德-秦（Raymond Chun）将接任最高职位。【原文：Toronto-Dominion Bank said Chief Executive Officer Bharat Masrani will retire in April and Raymond Chun will take the top job, as the bank grapples with investigations by the Department of Justice and financial regulators into lapses of money-laundering controls at its US branches.】

item.title: 消除美国道路交通事故死亡人数的登月计划
item.description:
美国交通部正在推动无线 "车对车 "技术，以减少交通事故死亡人数。但所谓的 V2X 应用之路并不清晰。【原文：

The US Department of Transportation is pushing wireless “vehicle-to-everything” technology to cut traffic fatalities. But the path to so-called V2X adoption isn’t clear.

】

item.title: 德国称 Uniper IPO 是出售公用事业的首选方案
item.description: 德国政府表示，首次公开募股将是出售公用事业公司 Uniper SE 的首选方案。【原文：The German government said an initial public offering would be the preferred option to sell utility Uniper SE.】

item.title: 央行鹰派加息后巴西雷亚尔跳涨
item.description: 巴西市场周四反弹，原因是巴西央行一致决定提高利率，并发表了一份被视为鹰派的声明，这表明巴西央行致力于使通胀率回到目标水平。【原文：Brazilian markets rallied on Thursday as the central bank’s unanimous decision to raise interest rates — and a statement viewed as hawkish — signaled its commitment to getting inflation back to target.】

item.title: Nuveen 基金达成 30 亿美元出售电力股票协议
item.description: 市政债券市场上最大的高收益基金准备出售其最大的头寸— 一家名为 Vistra Vision LLC 的电力公司的股票。【原文：The municipal-bond market’s largest high-yield fund is poised to offload its biggest position — equity shares of a power company called Vistra Vision LLC.】

item.title: 瑞士经济学家认为瑞士央行降息半点的可能性很大
item.description: 经济学家表示，美联储将利率下调半个百分点，增加了瑞士国家银行官员采取相同幅度降息举措的可能性。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s half-point interest-rate reduction has increased the chances that Swiss National Bank officials will follow with a move of the same size, economists say.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯瞄准阿尔巴的控制权以增强金属野心
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的目标是获得巴林铝冶炼厂的控制权，进一步推进其将矿业和金属业打造成巴林王国经济 "第三大支柱 "的计划。【原文：Saudi Arabia aims to gain control of Bahrain’s aluminum smelter, furthering its plan for mining and metals to become a “third pillar” of the kingdom’s economy.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯同意与 Topgolf Callaway 合作建设高尔夫球场
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯与总部位于美国的 Topgolf Callaway Brands Corp. 合作，在王国各地推出新的高尔夫设施，旨在加强体育基础设施建设，提高高尔夫运动在当地的普及率。【原文：Saudi Arabia has teamed up with US-based Topgolf Callaway Brands Corp. to launch new golf facilities across the kingdom as it aims to enhance sports infrastructure and increase the popularity of the game locally.】

item.title: 创纪录的金价为矿商提供了投资者赎回的机会
item.description:
利率下降和每盎司超过 2,600 美元的金银价格带来的不仅仅是额外收入。【原文：

Falling interest rates and a bullion price of more than $2,600 an ounce can add up to more than just extra revenue.

】

item.title: GoldenTree 收购与 Bawag 12 亿欧元贷款相关的风险转移项目
item.description: 据知情人士透露，GoldenTree 资产管理公司正在从 Bawag 集团公司购买与约 12 亿欧元（13 亿美元）贷款相关的重大风险转移。【原文：GoldenTree Asset Management is buying a significant risk transfer linked to about €1.2 billion ($1.3 billion) of loans from Bawag Group AG, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 信贷的最大赢家 AT1 在美联储之后有望获得资金支持
item.description: 美联储降息周期的开始，助长了投资者的乐观情绪，他们希望在信贷这个表现最好的市场上掀起一波期待已久的投资热潮。【原文：The start to the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cutting cycle has fueled optimism for a long-sought wave of investor money in credit’s best-performing market.】

item.title: 前谷歌高管创办的初创公司利用人工智能预测天气
item.description: 一家由谷歌前高管创办的初创公司旨在利用人工智能改善天气预报，加入英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp）和华为技术有限公司（Huawei Technologies Co.【原文：A startup founded by a former Google executive aims to use artificial intelligence to improve weather forecasting, joining technology behemoths like Nvidia Corp. and Huawei Technologies Co. in an increasingly crowded field.】

item.title: 西班牙在电动汽车关税投票前称赞中国为战略合作伙伴
item.description: 一位西班牙高级官员表示，欧洲需要中国作为 "战略伙伴"，帮助建设该集团的电动汽车产业，这与首相佩德罗-桑切斯反对欧盟对中国汽车征收关税计划的立场不谋而合。【原文：Europe needs China as a “strategic partner” in helping build the bloc’s electric vehicle industry, a top Spanish official said, echoing Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s position against EU plans to slap tariffs on Chinese cars.】

item.title: 据说 SpiceJet 的股票销售吸引了塔塔共同基金等机构的关注
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，SpiceJet Ltd. 3.58 亿美元的股票出售吸引了包括塔塔共同基金（Tata Mutual Fund）在内的几家大型投资者竞购，为这家裁员和延迟缴税的印度航空公司提供了一线生机。【原文：SpiceJet Ltd.’s $358 million share sale attracted bids from several large investors including Tata Mutual Fund, people familiar with the matter said, providing a lifeline to the Indian airline that has furloughed staff and delayed tax payments.】

item.title: KKR 将在与 Döpfner 的交易中卸下 Axel Springer 媒体资产
item.description: KKR & Co.和德国亿万富翁马蒂亚斯-多普弗纳（Mathias Döpfner）同意分拆媒体集团阿克塞尔-施普林格（Axel Springer），将其快速增长的分类广告部门从新闻业务中分离出来。【原文：KKR & Co. and German billionaire Mathias Döpfner agreed to split up media conglomerate Axel Springer, separating its fast-growing classifieds units from its news businesses.】

item.title: 英国央行维持利率不变后，英镑创 2022 年 3 月以来新高
item.description: 在英国央行维持利率稳定并表示不会急于放宽政策后，英镑兑美元汇率升至两年多来的最高水平。【原文：The pound rose to its highest level in more than two years against the dollar after the Bank of England held interest rates steady and said it won’t rush to ease policy.】

item.title: 英国央行明年将削减 1,000 亿英镑债券投资组合
item.description: 英国央行将保持削减债券资产负债表的步伐，这一决定可能会影响到英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）在即将到来的预算中的财政火力。【原文：The Bank of England will maintain the pace it is reducing its balance sheet of bonds, a decision that may have implications for how much fiscal firepower Chancellor Rachel Reeves has at the upcoming budget.】

item.title: TikTok 禁用令渐成现实，而应用程序用户却忽视了这一点
item.description: TikTok 在美国的前景突然变得更加暗淡了，尽管你在使用这款应用时不会意识到这一点。但首先...【原文：TikTok’s future in the US is suddenly looking much more dire, though you wouldn’t know from using the app. But first...】

item.title: 日本男童遇害后，习近平的民族主义面临反思
item.description: 在与竞争对手关系紧张的情况下，习近平主席掀起了一股中国民族主义浪潮，以提高政府的声望。现在，一名日本男孩的遇害暴露了这一策略的危险性。【原文：President Xi Jinping has overseen a surge in Chinese nationalism to boost his government’s popularity as tensions have frayed with rivals. Now, the murder of a Japanese boy is exposing the dangers of that tactic.】

item.title: 乌克兰延长利率暂停期，通胀加剧
item.description: 乌克兰中央银行连续第二次会议维持利率不变，这表明尽管战时预算日益紧张，但决策者不会容忍通货膨胀率上升。【原文：Ukraine’s central bank left interest rates unchanged for a second straight meeting in a sign that policymakers won’t tolerate higher inflation despite growing strains on the war-time budget.】

item.title: 土耳其连续六次按兵不动后暗示降息渐行渐近
item.description: 土耳其央行表示，在连续第六个月按兵不动后，它并不急于开始降息，但在放弃提及潜在的紧缩政策后，它暗示降息的脚步越来越近了。【原文：Turkey’s central bank indicated it’s in no hurry to start cutting interest rates after leaving borrowing costs on hold for a sixth straight month, though suggested such a move is getting closer after dropping a reference to potential tightening.】

item.title: 英国央行决定维持利率不变，誓言采取渐进式宽松政策
item.description: 英国央行警告投资者，它不会急于放松货币政策，决定不连续第二次下调借贷成本，因为它在等待通胀压力已经消退的进一步迹象。【原文：The Bank of England warned investors it won’t rush to ease monetary policy, deciding against a second consecutive cut in borrowing costs as it awaits further signs inflationary pressures have subsided.】

item.title: 华尔街 5.1 万亿美元的三重魔咒是下一个市场考验
item.description: 就在华尔街交易员对美联储的减息政策跃跃欲试之际，周五的美国期权到期日又可能给市场带来更多冲击。【原文：Just as Wall Street traders come to grips with the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cut, Friday’s US options expiration threatens to whipsaw the market some more.】

item.title: 英国广播公司称前哈罗德百货公司老板阿尔-法耶强奸、虐待妇女
item.description: 据英国广播公司（BBC）报道，五名妇女称，她们在伦敦哈罗斯百货公司工作时遭到该公司前老板穆罕默德-法耶德（Mohamed Al Fayed）的强奸，另有 20 多名妇女声称遭到这位已故亿万富翁的性侵犯。【原文：Five women say they were raped by former Harrods owner Mohamed Al Fayed when they worked at the London department store, while more than 20 claim they were sexually assaulted by the late billionaire, the BBC reported.】

item.title: 中国与欧盟贸易官员就电动汽车关税问题举行最后谈判
item.description: 中国的主要贸易官员正在欧洲进行最后的努力，以避免在几天后的最后期限前对电动汽车征收迫在眉睫的关税。【原文：China’s lead trade official is in Europe on a last-ditch mission to avert looming tariffs on electric cars ahead of a deadline that’s only days away.】
